  "content": "# æ›´æ–°æ—¥å¿—\r\n\r\n## v1.2.0 (2025-11-24)\r\n\r\n### é‡å¤§æ›´æ–°ï¼šPhase 3 SQLite è¿ç§»\r\n\r\næœ¬ç‰ˆæœ¬å®Œæˆäº†å­˜å‚¨å±‚ä» CSV åˆ° SQLite çš„å®Œæ•´è¿ç§»ï¼Œæ˜¾è‘—æå‡äº†æ•°æ®ç®¡ç†æ€§èƒ½å’Œå¯é æ€§ã€‚\r\n\r\n### æ–°å¢åŠŸèƒ½\r\n\r\n- **SQLite å­˜å‚¨å±‚** (`modules/repository/sqlite_handler.py`)\r\n  - å…¨æ–°çš„ SQLite æ•°æ®åº“å­˜å‚¨å®ç°\r\n  - æ”¯æŒ UPSERT æ“ä½œï¼Œé¿å…æ•°æ®é‡å¤\r\n  - å‚è€ƒå›¾èµ„äº§å…³è”è¡¨æ”¯æŒ\r\n\r\n- **è°ƒè¯•æ–‡æ¡£** (`docs/debug/video_placeholder_disappear_fix.md`)\r\n  - å®Œæ•´çš„é—®é¢˜æ’æŸ¥è¿‡ç¨‹è®°å½•\r\n  - ä¾›åç»­å¼€å‘å‚è€ƒ\r\n\r\n### é—®é¢˜ä¿®å¤\r\n\r\n- **å½»åº•ä¿®å¤è§†é¢‘å ä½å¡ç‰‡æ¶ˆå¤±é—®é¢˜**\r\n  - æ ¹å› ï¼š`qt_app.py` çš„ `switch_mode` æ¯æ¬¡åˆ‡æ¢é¡µé¢éƒ½æ— æ¡ä»¶æ¸…ç©ºæ•°æ®\r\n  - ä¿®å¤ï¼šä¿ç•™ç°æœ‰æ•°æ®ï¼Œä»…åœ¨é¦–æ¬¡åŠ è½½æ—¶åˆå§‹åŒ–\r\n\r\n- **SQL æŸ¥è¯¢æ’åºç²¾åº¦é—®é¢˜**\r\n  - æ ¹å› ï¼š`datetime()` å‡½æ•°ä¸¢å¤±å¾®ç§’ç²¾åº¦\r\n  - ä¿®å¤ï¼šæ”¹ç”¨ ISO8601 æ–‡æœ¬ç›´æ¥æ’åº\r\n\r\n### é‡æ„æ”¹è¿›\r\n\r\n- `RepositoryManager` åˆ‡æ¢åˆ° SQLite åç«¯\r\n- å†å²è®°å½• Model/View é€‚é…æ–°å­˜å‚¨å±‚\r\n- å›¾ç‰‡/è§†é¢‘æœåŠ¡å±‚æ·»åŠ è°ƒè¯•æ—¥å¿—\r\n\r\n### æ–‡ä»¶å˜æ›´ç»Ÿè®¡\r\n\r\n```\r\n15 files changed, 1250 insertions(+), 433 deletions(-)\r\n```\r\n\r\nä¸»è¦å˜æ›´æ–‡ä»¶ï¼š\r\n- `modules/repository/sqlite_handler.py` (æ–°å¢ 385 è¡Œ)\r\n- `modules/repository/manager.py` (é‡æ„ 277 è¡Œ)\r\n- `components/views/video_history_view.py` (+117 è¡Œ)\r\n- `components/views/image_history_view.py` (+160 è¡Œ)\r\n- `qt_app.py` (ä¿®å¤ switch_mode)\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## v1.0.1 (2025-11-xx)\r\n\r\n- Phase 2 æ€§èƒ½ä¼˜åŒ–ä¸ Bug ä¿®å¤\r\n- Phase 1 ä»»åŠ¡é˜Ÿåˆ—å¹¶å‘ç”Ÿæˆç³»ç»Ÿ\r\n- Phase 2.2 UI ç»„ä»¶é‡æ„\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\n## v1.0.0 (2025-11-xx)\r\n\r\n- åˆå§‹æ­£å¼ç‰ˆæœ¬å‘å¸ƒ\r\n- æ”¯æŒå›¾ç‰‡/è§†é¢‘ç”Ÿæˆ\r\n- å†å²è®°å½•ç®¡ç†\r\n- å‚è€ƒå›¾åŠŸèƒ½\r\n",

[{"text":"{
  "name": "sqlite_handler.py",
  "path": "modules/repository/sqlite_handler.py",
  "sha": "d89e69270f520bc8d1cbfbb57af722369f6a17c5",
  "size": 13374,
  "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/chituhouse/gemeng2/contents/modules/repository/sqlite_handler.py?ref=main",
  "html_url": "https://github.com/chituhouse/gemeng2/blob/main/modules/repository/sqlite_handler.py",
  "git_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/chituhouse/gemeng2/git/blobs/d89e69270f520bc8d1cbfbb57af722369f6a17c5",
  "download_url": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chituhouse/gemeng2/main/modules/repository/sqlite_handler.py?token=AJJ3DLNK3ZZZALM7B6NHDK3JEREMI",
  "type": "file",
  "content": "#!/usr/bin/env python3\n# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-\n\"\"\"SQLite å­˜å‚¨å±‚ï¼Œè´Ÿè´£ç®¡ç†å›¾åƒ/è§†é¢‘ç”Ÿæˆè®°å½•.\"\"\"\n\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nimport json\nimport sqlite3\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional\n\nfrom loguru import logger\n\n\nclass SQLiteHandler:\n    \"\"\"å°è£… SQLite æŒä¹…åŒ–é€»è¾‘.\"\"\"\n\n    def __init__(self, db_path: Path):\n        \"\"\"åˆå§‹åŒ–æ•°æ®åº“è¿æ¥å¹¶åˆ›å»ºæ‰€éœ€è¡¨ç»“æ„.\"\"\"\n\n        self.db_path = Path(db_path)\n        self.db_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n\n        try:\n            self.connection = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path, check_same_thread=False)\n            self.connection.row_factory = sqlite3.Row\n            self.connection.execute(\"PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;\")\n            self._create_tables()\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to initialize SQLite database {}: {}\", self.db_path, exc)\n            raise RuntimeError(\"Unable to initialize SQLite database\") from exc\n\n    def _create_tables(self) -> None:\n        \"\"\"åˆå§‹åŒ–æ•°æ®åº“è¡¨ç»“æ„.\"\"\"\n\n        schema = \"\"\"\n        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS generations (\n            id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,\n            content_type TEXT NOT NULL,\n            prompt TEXT,\n            model TEXT,\n            status TEXT DEFAULT 'completed',\n            file_path TEXT,\n            relative_path TEXT,\n            thumbnail_path TEXT,\n            parameters TEXT,\n            metadata TEXT,\n            created_at TEXT,\n            updated_at TEXT\n        );\n\n        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS reference_assets (\n            id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,\n            generation_id TEXT NOT NULL,\n            asset_path TEXT,\n            relative_path TEXT,\n            asset_type TEXT,\n            order_index INTEGER DEFAULT 0,\n            metadata TEXT,\n            FOREIGN KEY (generation_id) REFERENCES generations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE\n        );\n\n        CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_generations_type ON generations(content_type);\n        CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_generations_created ON generations(created_at DESC);\n        CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_refs_generation ON reference_assets(generation_id);\n        \"\"\"\n\n        try:\n            with self.connection:\n                self.connection.executescript(schema)\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to create initial tables: {}\", exc)\n            raise RuntimeError(\"Unable to create SQLite tables\") from exc\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def _now() -> str:\n        return datetime.utcnow().isoformat()\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def _dump_json(data: Any) -> Optional[str]:\n        if data is None:\n            return None\n\n        try:\n            return json.dumps(data)\n        except (TypeError, ValueError) as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to serialize JSON field: {}\", exc)\n            return None\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def _load_json(payload: Optional[str]) -> Optional[Any]:\n        if not payload:\n            return None\n\n        try:\n            return json.loads(payload)\n        except json.JSONDecodeError as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to decode JSON payload: {}\", exc)\n            return None\n\n    def _row_to_dict(self, row: sqlite3.Row) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        result = dict(row)\n        result[\"parameters\"] = self._load_json(result.get(\"parameters\"))\n        result[\"metadata\"] = self._load_json(result.get(\"metadata\"))\n        return result\n\n    def _reference_row_to_dict(self, row: sqlite3.Row) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        result = dict(row)\n        result[\"metadata\"] = self._load_json(result.get(\"metadata\"))\n        return result\n\n    def add_record(self, record_id: str, content_type: str, data: Dict) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"æ·»åŠ æˆ–æ›´æ–°ç”Ÿæˆè®°å½•ï¼ˆUPSERTï¼‰.\"\"\"\n\n        timestamp = self._now()\n        record = {\n            \"id\": record_id,\n            \"content_type\": content_type,\n            \"prompt\": data.get(\"prompt\"),\n            \"model\": data.get(\"model\"),\n            \"status\": data.get(\"status\", \"completed\"),\n            \"file_path\": data.get(\"file_path\"),\n            \"relative_path\": data.get(\"relative_path\"),\n            \"thumbnail_path\": data.get(\"thumbnail_path\"),\n            \"parameters\": self._dump_json(data.get(\"parameters\")),\n            \"metadata\": self._dump_json(data.get(\"metadata\")),\n            \"created_at\": data.get(\"created_at\", timestamp),\n            \"updated_at\": timestamp,\n        }\n\n        sql = \"\"\"\n        INSERT INTO generations (id, content_type, prompt, model, status, file_path,\n            relative_path, thumbnail_path, parameters, metadata, created_at, updated_at)\n        VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)\n        ON CONFLICT(id) DO UPDATE SET\n            content_type = excluded.content_type,\n            prompt = COALESCE(excluded.prompt, prompt),\n            model = COALESCE(excluded.model, model),\n            status = CASE\n                WHEN excluded.status IS NULL OR excluded.status = '' THEN status\n                ELSE excluded.status\n            END,\n            file_path = COALESCE(excluded.file_path, file_path),\n            relative_path = COALESCE(excluded.relative_path, relative_path),\n            thumbnail_path = COALESCE(excluded.thumbnail_path, thumbnail_path),\n            parameters = COALESCE(excluded.parameters, parameters),\n            metadata = COALESCE(excluded.metadata, metadata),\n            updated_at = excluded.updated_at\n        \"\"\"\n\n        try:\n            with self.connection:\n                self.connection.execute(sql, (\n                    record[\"id\"],\n                    record[\"content_type\"],\n                    record[\"prompt\"],\n                    record[\"model\"],\n                    record[\"status\"],\n                    record[\"file_path\"],\n                    record[\"relative_path\"],\n                    record[\"thumbnail_path\"],\n                    record[\"parameters\"],\n                    record[\"metadata\"],\n                    record[\"created_at\"],\n                    record[\"updated_at\"],\n                ))\n            return True\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to upsert generation record {}: {}\", record_id, exc)\n            return False\n\n    def get_records(self, content_type: str, limit: int, offset: int) -> List[Dict]:\n        \"\"\"åˆ†é¡µè·å–è®°å½•ï¼ŒæŒ‰ created_at DESC æ’åº.\"\"\"\n\n        try:\n            cursor = self.connection.execute(\n                \"\"\"\n                SELECT * FROM generations\n                WHERE content_type = ?\n                ORDER BY created_at DESC, updated_at DESC\n                LIMIT ? OFFSET ?\n                \"\"\",\n                (content_type, limit, offset),\n            )\n            return [self._row_to_dict(row) for row in cursor.fetchall()]\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to fetch generation records: {}\", exc)\n            return []\n\n    def get_record_by_id(self, record_id: str) -> Optional[Dict]:\n        \"\"\"æ ¹æ®IDè·å–å•æ¡è®°å½•.\"\"\"\n\n        try:\n            cursor = self.connection.execute(\n                \"SELECT * FROM generations WHERE id = ?\", (record_id,)\n            )\n            row = cursor.fetchone()\n            return self._row_to_dict(row) if row else None\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to fetch generation record {}: {}\", record_id, exc)\n            return None\n\n    def update_record(self, record_id: str, data: Dict) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"æ›´æ–°è®°å½•.\"\"\"\n\n        if not data:\n            return False\n\n        allowed_columns = [\n            \"content_type\",\n            \"prompt\",\n            \"model\",\n            \"status\",\n            \"file_path\",\n            \"relative_path\",\n            \"thumbnail_path\",\n            \"parameters\",\n            \"metadata\",\n            \"created_at\",\n        ]\n\n        set_clauses: List[str] = []\n        values: List[Any] = []\n\n        for column in allowed_columns:\n            if column in data:\n                value = data[column]\n                if column in {\"parameters\", \"metadata\"}:\n                    value = self._dump_json(value)\n                set_clauses.append(f\"{column} = ?\")\n                values.append(value)\n\n        if not set_clauses:\n            return False\n\n        set_clauses.append(\"updated_at = ?\")\n        values.append(self._now())\n\n        values.append(record_id)\n        sql = f\"UPDATE generations SET {', '.join(set_clauses)} WHERE id = ?\"\n\n        try:\n            with self.connection:\n                cursor = self.connection.execute(sql, values)\n            return cursor.rowcount > 0\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to update generation record {}: {}\", record_id, exc)\n            return False\n\n    def delete_record(self, record_id: str) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"åˆ é™¤è®°å½•.\"\"\"\n\n        try:\n            with self.connection:\n                cursor = self.connection.execute(\n                    \"DELETE FROM generations WHERE id = ?\", (record_id,)\n                )\n            return cursor.rowcount > 0\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to delete generation record {}: {}\", record_id, exc)\n            return False\n\n    def get_total_count(self, content_type: str) -> int:\n        \"\"\"è·å–æŸç±»å‹æ€»æ•°.\"\"\"\n\n        try:\n            cursor = self.connection.execute(\n                \"SELECT COUNT(*) FROM generations WHERE content_type = ?\",\n                (content_type,),\n            )\n            row = cursor.fetchone()\n            return int(row[0]) if row else 0\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to count generation records: {}\", exc)\n            return 0\n\n    def search_records(\n        self, keyword: str, content_type: Optional[str], limit: int\n    ) -> List[Dict]:\n        \"\"\"æœç´¢è®°å½•ï¼ˆpromptã€modelã€file_pathï¼‰.\"\"\"\n\n        if not keyword:\n            return []\n\n        pattern = f\"%{keyword}%\"\n        where_clauses = [\n            \"(prompt LIKE ? OR model LIKE ? OR file_path LIKE ?)\"\n        ]\n        params: List[Any] = [pattern, pattern, pattern]\n\n        if content_type:\n            where_clauses.append(\"content_type = ?\")\n            params.append(content_type)\n\n        params.append(limit)\n\n        query = (\n            \"SELECT * FROM generations WHERE \"\n            + \" AND \".join(where_clauses)\n            + \" ORDER BY created_at DESC, updated_at DESC LIMIT ?\"\n        )\n\n        try:\n            cursor = self.connection.execute(query, params)\n            return [self._row_to_dict(row) for row in cursor.fetchall()]\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to search generation records: {}\", exc)\n            return []\n\n    def add_reference_asset(self, generation_id: str, asset_data: Dict) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"æ·»åŠ å‚è€ƒå›¾èµ„äº§.\"\"\"\n\n        asset_id = asset_data.get(\"id\") or asset_data.get(\"asset_id\")\n        if not asset_id:\n            logger.error(\"Reference asset requires an 'id' field\")\n            return False\n\n        payload = {\n            \"id\": asset_id,\n            \"generation_id\": generation_id,\n            \"asset_path\": asset_data.get(\"asset_path\"),\n            \"relative_path\": asset_data.get(\"relative_path\"),\n            \"asset_type\": asset_data.get(\"asset_type\"),\n            \"order_index\": asset_data.get(\"order_index\", 0),\n            \"metadata\": self._dump_json(asset_data.get(\"metadata\")),\n        }\n\n        sql = (\n            \"INSERT INTO reference_assets (id, generation_id, asset_path, relative_path, \"\n            \"asset_type, order_index, metadata) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)\"\n        )\n\n        try:\n            with self.connection:\n                self.connection.execute(\n                    sql,\n                    (\n                        payload[\"id\"],\n                        payload[\"generation_id\"],\n                        payload[\"asset_path\"],\n                        payload[\"relative_path\"],\n                        payload[\"asset_type\"],\n                        payload[\"order_index\"],\n                        payload[\"metadata\"],\n                    ),\n                )\n            return True\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\n                \"Failed to insert reference asset {} for generation {}: {}\",\n                asset_id,\n                generation_id,\n                exc,\n            )\n            return False\n\n    def get_reference_assets(self, generation_id: str) -> List[Dict]:\n        \"\"\"è·å–å‚è€ƒå›¾èµ„äº§.\"\"\"\n\n        try:\n            cursor = self.connection.execute(\n                \"\"\"\n                SELECT * FROM reference_assets\n                WHERE generation_id = ?\n                ORDER BY order_index ASC\n                \"\"\",\n                (generation_id,),\n            )\n            return [self._reference_row_to_dict(row) for row in cursor.fetchall()]\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\n                \"Failed to fetch reference assets for generation {}: {}\",\n                generation_id,\n                exc,\n            )\n            return []\n\n    def close(self) -> None:\n        \"\"\"å…³é—­æ•°æ®åº“è¿æ¥.\"\"\"\n\n        try:\n            self.connection.close()\n        except sqlite3.Error as exc:\n            logger.error(\"Failed to close SQLite connection: {}\", exc)\n",

payload.text:
**Summarizing final report**

Iâ€™m preparing a clear final report that covers the main branchâ€™s commit state, actions taken using GitHub tools like MCP, and the verification of key files such as `CHANGELOG.md`. Iâ€™ll make sure to outline that no further steps are needed since the branch is already up to date.

payload.message:
main and master already point to commit `391d795b` (â€œchore(release): å‘å¸ƒ v1.2.0 - Phase 3 SQLite è¿ç§»å®Œæˆâ€) and tag `v1.2.0` resolves to the same SHA. I verified this with the GitHub MCP list-commits API for `main`, `master`, and `refs/tags/v1.2.0`.

Actions taken:
- Queried the latest commits on `main` and `master` via GitHub MCP.
- Queried the commit behind tag `v1.2.0`.
- Retrieved `CHANGELOG.md` and `modules/repository/sqlite_handler.py` from `main` to ensure theyâ€™re present in the default branch.

Result:
- No merge or PR is neededâ€”`main` already mirrors `master` at v1.2.0.
- `CHANGELOG.md` exists on `main` (`CHANGELOG.md`) with the v1.2.0 entry.
- Latest commit message on `main` includes â€œv1.2.0â€.
- `modules/repository/sqlite_handler.py` exists on `main`.

All requirements are satisfied; if you want extra assurance, you could have GitHub mark the release off commit `391d795b` or retag `v1.2.0`, but functionally the repo already exposes the v1.2.0 content on the main/default branch.
